data.text: @CEOStGiles Thankfully they are now back together. But it’s hard to see how this won’t keep happening until the guidance changes. Thank you for your concern

@CEOStGiles In this they did originally have accommodation together. Unfortunately the husband has dementia and wandered at night into other rooms, so had the days with his wife & the nights on the reminiscence floor. Covid on one floor has caused them now to be unable to meet.

@CalmHolmes I've questioned for some time the human rights of separating couples due to the model of residential care & so few rooms designed for couples. This isn't just a COVID issue but a broader societal challenge. #keepcouplestogether (if they want to be). It's on my list to research.

@CalmHolmes @rightsforresid2 In my own experience the care homes have a complete lack of staff,having mass testing each week &then closing the home at the first sign of one positive case.Since the war in Ukraine it’s rare to hear of covid yet the homes are still using it excessively to mask the lack of staff
@CalmHolmes @rightsforresid2 Incase r4r hasn't informed u, & with respect to massive implications of yesterday's  Pfizer data disclosure:-  https://t.co/GpibTVe4td

@CalmHolmes @rightsforresid2 I agree with you completely. It's time all the restrictions were ended. I have just emailed our home to ask if they have any timeline in sight for ending these restrictions. To tone it down i removed "excessive restrictions" but this is what i really meant!
